message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SE 

The paper discusses a trust-based and privacy-preserving customer selection scheme in ubiquitous computing, which involves security and privacy issues. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also involves distributed computing and data management, which could fall under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The use of communication resources and authentication protocols could also be related to cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Finally, the design and analysis of the proposed scheme could be considered as software engineering, which falls under cs.SE (Software Engineering).
